page.title: 03GAVINTON, DUNS CONTINUED
page.content: THE POPULATION OF GAVINTON IS {148 ADULTS AND{30}CHILDREN. MANY OF THESE ARE PENSIONERS BUT MORE FAMILIES WITH YOUNG CHILDREN HAVE MOVED IN RECENTLY. PEOPLE COME MAINLY BECAUSE THEY WANT TO LIVE IN A QUIET FRIENDLY PLACE. THE VILLAGE HAS A POST OFFICE AND GENERAL STORE COMBINED. IT ALSO HAS A COMMUNITY HALL (BUTTERWELL HALL),BUILT IN 1929. AT THE FOOT OF THE VILLAGE, ON GROUND WHICH USED TO BE THE GLEBE OF THE CHURCH, IS A SMALL COUNCIL HOUSING ESTATE. OTHER HOUSING IS PRIVATE. GAVINTON USED TO HAVE A SCHOOL, BUILT IN 1874 BUT CLOSED IN 1966, NOW A HOUSE. THERE ARE THE REMAINS OF A WELL, "THE BUTTERWELL" & ONE HOUSE HAS TWO BEE BOLES.
